main event: On July 7, 1963, a disc-shaped object was observed flying in the Pacific Ocean.
interesting points: The object had a white lower part and a flaming upper part., The sighting involved multiple types of observation including ground-radar and air-visual., The object maneuvered and made a final reflection on the sea surface., The estimated distance from the observer was about 10 miles., The duration of the sighting was approximately 3 seconds.
sighted object: disc-shaped, white lower part and flaming upper part
witness description: Second officer reported seeing the object.
